comments.raw_text:
Note: I have also been able to replicate this problem in Firefox 3 and 4, even having completely uninstalled Firefox, and having deleted all profiles.

I use a whitelist to maintain my cookies, and have Firefox delete all other cookies (along with history, cache, etc.) upon closing Firefox. For a long time this has worked flawlessly.

Several months ago, around the release of Firefox 4 I noticed that my list of cookie exceptions was going missing, resulting in those cookies I wanted to keep being deleted. Upgrading to version 4 had no impact, but a clean install and wiping all profiles appeared to prevent this issue from occurring, at least for a time.

In Firefox 6, it appears that the site exceptions are still listed in about:permissions (but NOT in cookie exceptions), but instead of having cookies set to "allow" they are set to "allow for session".

I run a pretty minimal set of addons and extensions. Almost all of them are for basic web functionality, such as flash. I will see if I can replicate the issue without any addons enabled.

To further clarify the behaviour of this issue. In Firefox 3, whilst the cookie exceptions list was not being populated, it did appear that the preferences were still kept behind the scenes, so it wasn't tossing whitelisted cookies upon closing Firefox.

As far as I know, it's only in FF6 that cookie preferences are actively being deleted/reset, causing whitelisted cookies to be list... in older versions it's just the list that doesn't seem to get populated properly.

Also encountering the problem with blacklisting certain cookies and not only in private mode but also in "standard" mode. So I think the bug is even more general - see explanation:

They list get deleted (maybe after some restart or crash, couldnt figure it out yet). I never delete history/sitepreferences/...

Workaround, just to show that it is really deleted from the database!

If you use win7 filerollback for the permissions.sqllite file they are back!
Found that trick here:
https://support.mozilla.org/de/questions/969673
This is the only way to restore, because sync doesnt sycn the white/blacklisted rules, see here:
https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=978010

Similar here for whitelisting cookies:
https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=789052
and also here that they get deleted really easily and reproducible:
https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1005333
